citation.article-title: Pseudomonas cannabina pv. cannabina pv. nov., and Pseudomonas cannabina pv. alisalensis (Cintas Koike and Bull, 2000)comb.nov.,are members of the emended species Pseudomonas cannabina (ex Šutič & Dowson 1959) Gardan, Shafik, Belouin, Brosch, Grimont & Grimont 1999

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas cannabina pv. alisalensis comb. nov.
Description is the same as is given for P. cannabina.
This pathogen produces a severe blight on broccoli raab (cv ‘Sorento’ or ‘Spring’) and minor spots on oats (Avena sativa cv. ‘Montezuma’) and does not cause disease on Cannabis sativa.
All strains tested produce 18:1 ω7c 11-methyl and are lysed by bacteriophage PBS1.
Strains assimilate sucrose, d(+) arabitol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d(-) tartrate, d(+) malate, d-galacturonate, protocatechuate, (-) quinate, d-alanine, α-ketoglutarate.
This pathovar can be differentiated from other pathovars by rep-PCR using the BOX-A1R primers and by 16S rDNA sequences.
The pathotype strain is ATCC BAA-566Pt= CFBP 6866Pt= ICMP 15200Pt (originally BS91Pt).
